title: geth --testnet connecting to some "non-existent" network
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `Geth/v1.8.15-stable-89451f7c/linux-amd64/go1.10.4`
OS & Version: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.15.0-1021-azure x86_64) 
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
connection to ropsten network

#### Actual behaviour
connection to some undefined network
console says:

INFO [08-31|12:30:09.147] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 3 Homestead: 0 DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: true EIP150: 0 EIP155: 10 EIP158: 10 Byzantium: 1700000 Constantinople: <nil> Engine: ethash}"

but actually it has different block count, and separate balances

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
downloaded latest geth
mkdir ropsten
./geth --datadir ropsten/ --testnet

#### Backtrace

````
node@test:~$ ./geth --datadir ropsten/ --testnet
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.610] Maximum peer count                       ETH=25 LES=0 total=25
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.611] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.8.15-stable-89451f7c/linux-amd64/go1.10.4
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.611] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/home/node/ropsten/geth/chaindata cache=768 handles=512
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.644] Writing custom genesis block 
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.654] Persisted trie from memory database      nodes=355 size=51.89kB time=1.746924ms gcnodes=0 gcsize=0.00B gctime=0s livenodes=1 livesize=0.00B
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.654] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 3 Homestead: 0 DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: true EIP150: 0 EIP155: 10 EIP158: 10 Byzantium: 1700000 Constantinople: <nil> Engine: ethash}"
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.654] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=/home/node/ropsten/geth/ethash count=3
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.654] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=/home/node/.ethash             count=2
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.654] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=3
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.655] Loaded most recent local header          number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.655] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576

INFO [08-31|12:24:58.655] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [08-31|12:24:58.655] Starting P2P networking 
INFO [08-31|12:25:00.776] UDP listener up                          self=enode://4f94fb8f43a2d7f0fc115e27956b5acd725011851e243673cbf690de11490cc4fa517adda03416bd9ec2a2f0f0b0424564597a308237bf022fd31789d317e841@[::]:30303
INFO [08-31|12:25:00.777] RLPx listener up                         self=enode://4f94fb8f43a2d7f0fc115e27956b5acd725011851e243673cbf690de11490cc4fa517adda03416bd9ec2a2f0f0b0424564597a308237bf022fd31789d317e841@[::]:30303
INFO [08-31|12:25:00.779] IPC endpoint opened                      url=/home/node/ropsten/geth.ipc
INFO [08-31|12:25:50.777] Block synchronisation started 
WARN [08-31|12:25:51.908] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=865a63255b3bb680 err="peer is stalling"
WARN [08-31|12:27:01.840] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=865a63255b3bb680 err="peer is stalling"
INFO [08-31|12:27:11.013] Imported new state entries               count=657 elapsed=209.503µs processed=657 pending=2307 retry=0 duplicate=0 unexpected=0

INFO [08-31|12:27:11.866] Imported new block receipts              count=192 elapsed=6.808ms   number=384 hash=fe6a05…d2942b size=768.00B ignored=0

INFO [08-31|12:27:12.260] Imported new block headers               count=192  elapsed=24.267ms  number=3840 hash=31a132…8a8afb ignored=0
````


Before syncing started it shows correct highest block number, after starting sync - it shows strange number. Also, after sync has been ended, I have tried to mine blocks (successful) but this balances is not visible at real ropsten, and presented only in this undefined network

````
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 0,
  highestBlock: 3945882,
  knownStates: 0,
  pulledStates: 0,
  startingBlock: 0
}
> net
{
  listening: true,
  peerCount: 2,
  version: "3",
  getListening: function(callback),
  getPeerCount: function(callback),
  getVersion: function(callback)
}
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 29952,
  highestBlock: 1203201,
  knownStates: 7932,
  pulledStates: 7932,
  startingBlock: 0
}
> eth.syncing
````
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
